dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so you know Singles' Day, right? November 11th? Like, China's massive online shopping event?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so you know Singles' Day, right? November eleventh? Like, China's massive online shopping event?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chinasand the worldsbiggest online shopping event, known as Singles Day, takes place on November 11, with Alibaba and a record number of other Chinese e-commerce companies offering massive discounts over the 24-hour period.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, the biggest. Uh, I mean, it *was* the biggest, right? I've been hearing some chatter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, the biggest. Uh, I mean, it was the biggest, right? I've been hearing some chatter.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It has become by far and away the largest shopping event in the world, raking in just over $30 billion in gross merchandise volume last yearand sales are expected to hit $37 billion by that same metric this year, according to Forrester Forecasts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It's, um, facing a really uncertain future. Things are totally shifting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It's, um, facing a really uncertain future. Things are totally shifting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Really? I thought it was just, like, growing every year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Really? I thought it was just, like, growing every year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The e-commerce festival is expected to be bigger and more international than ever in 2019, with Alibaba increasing the range of items on sale and adding 1 million new products on offer this year, the company said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nope. Apparently, Alibaba and pretty much all the other Chinese e-commerce companies are scaling back their massive discounts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope. Apparently, Alibaba and pretty much all the other Chinese e-commerce companies are scaling back their massive discounts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As discounts get bigger, promotions are also getting ramped up to new levels.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, so discounts are shrinking? [overlaps] That's a big deal for shoppers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, so discounts are shrinking? That's a big deal for shoppers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As discounts get bigger, promotions are also getting ramped up to new levels.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Big deal. And get this: back in 2009, there were 200,000 brands participating. Last year? Only 27.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Big deal. And get this: back in two thousand nine, there were two hundred thousand brands participating. Last year? Only twenty seven.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: the event boasts over 200,000 participating brandsup from 60,000 in 2017 and just 27 in 2009.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Twenty-seven?! That's insane. What happened?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Twenty-seven?! That's insane. What happened?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah. Gross merchandise volume, uh, last year was just over $30 billion, but this year it's expected to plummet to $3 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah. Gross merchandise volume, uh, last year was just over thirty billion dollars, but this year it's expected to plummet to three billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It has become by far and away the largest shopping event in the world, raking in just over $30 billion in gross merchandise volume last yearand sales are expected to hit $37 billion by that same metric this year, according to Forrester Forecasts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa. That's, like, a tenth of what it was. And I heard some US retailers are pulling out too?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa. That's, like, a tenth of what it was. And I heard some U S retailers are pulling out too?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A larger number of U.S. retailersalmost 25%, according to Adobe, plan to get involved, including big names ranging from Apple to Estee Lauder, posting deals on Alibabas platforms as well as their own U.S. websites.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Almost 25% of them. Big names like Apple and Estee Lauder are just, you know, not doing deals on Alibaba or even their own US sites.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Almost twenty five percent of them. Big names like Apple and Estee Lauder are just, you know, not doing deals on Alibaba or even their own U S sites.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A larger number of U.S. retailersalmost 25%, according to Adobe, plan to get involved, including big names ranging from Apple to Estee Lauder, posting deals on Alibabas platforms as well as their own U.S. websites.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, less international, fewer brands... and I saw something about celebrities?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, less international, fewer brands... and I saw something about celebrities?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The e-commerce festival is expected to be bigger and more international than ever in 2019, with Alibaba increasing the range of items on sale and adding 1 million new products on offer this year, the company said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah. Taylor Swift canceled her headlining performance. And Kim K, she publicly disavowed her Tmall livestream.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah. Taylor Swift canceled her headlining performance. And Kim K, she publicly disavowed her Tmall livestream.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Taylor Swift is set to perform as the headliner in the opening gala this year, while Kim Kardashian did a livestream on Tmall to launch her fragrances for the shopping festival.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] No way! So, no star power either. What about the consumers themselves?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No way! So, no star power either. What about the consumers themselves?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibaba, which kicks off the event by hosting extravagant fashion shows and concerts, is also bringing in more starpower: Taylor Swift is set to perform as the headliner in the opening gala this year, while Kim Kardashian did a livestream on Tmall to launch her fragrances for the shopping festival.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, Chinese consumers can't really shop on Taobao or Tmall for US goods anymore, because of, um, boycotts. They're turning away from international retailers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, Chinese consumers can't really shop on Taobao or Tmall for U S goods anymore, because of, um, boycotts. They're turning away from international retailers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chinese consumers can shop on Alibabas main websites, Taobao and Tmall, to find the biggest deals, while international shoppers must use AliExpress.com.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so it's all just shrinking. It's not the "SuperBowl for brands" that Jiang Fan from Alibaba used to call it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so it's all just shrinking. It's not the SuperBowl for brands that Jiang Fan from Alibaba used to call it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Think of 11/11 as the SuperBowl for brands, Jiang Fan, president of Alibabas Taobao and Tmall businesses, told CNBC. Its an opportunity to pull out all the stops to wow Chinese consumers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Definitely not. But hereâ€™s the wild twist.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely not. But here's the wild twist.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A recent survey found that almost 80% of Chinese shoppers actually plan to *increase* their purchases of American goods this Singles' Day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A recent survey found that almost eighty percent of Chinese shoppers actually plan to increase their purchases of American goods this Singles' Day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Almost 80% of Chinese shoppers said that they plan to boycott American goods during Singles Day, according to a recent survey from AlixPartners, which predicts the U.S.-China trade war taking a toll on participating U.S. brands this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, so the trade war is, uh, actually boosting sales for *some* US brands? That's, like, completely counterintuitive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, so the trade war is, uh, actually boosting sales for some U S brands? That's, like, completely counterintuitive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Almost 80% of Chinese shoppers said that they plan to boycott American goods during Singles Day, according to a recent survey from AlixPartners, which predicts the U.S.-China trade war taking a toll on participating U.S. brands this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? It's a really strange time for the biggest shopping event in the world. Even Jack Ma stepped down this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? It's a really strange time for the biggest shopping event in the world. Even Jack Ma stepped down this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 2019 will be Alibabas first year organizing 11/11 without founder Jack Ma at the helm, after Chinas richest man stepped down from his position as chairman in September.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's definitely an uncertain future for 11/11, that's for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's definitely an uncertain future for eleven over eleven, that's for sure.
